thread.title: Administration searches for new approach to aiding rebels in Syria
thread.title_full: Administration searches for new approach to aiding rebels in Syria

title: Administration searches for new approach to aiding rebels in Syria
text:
17 Administration searches for new approach to aiding rebels in Syria 
The Washington Post: The Obama administration is moving toward major changes in its military train-and-equip program for the Syrian opposition after the acknowledged failure of efforts to create a new force of rebel fighters to combat the Islamic State there.In comments that appeared to shock even many of those involved in Syria policy elsewhere in the government, Gen. Lloyd J. Austin III, the head of the U.S. Central Command, told Congress on Wednesday that only “four or five” trainees from the program, a $500 million plan officially launched in December to prepare as many as 5,400 fighters this year, have ended up “in the fight” inside Syria.
